tier_1_determinative.attempt_to_extract_cash: Yes, the accused attempted to extract cash and valuables from the victim Vijay Sadavate by threatening to kill him.
tier_1_determinative.threat_to_kill: Yes, threats to kill were extended to Vijay Sadavate during the robbery attempt.
tier_1_determinative.weapon_used: Knife was used by one of the accused to inflict injury on Vijay Sadavate.
tier_1_determinative.injury_detail: Vijay Sadavate received a bleeding injury on the back of his head, and Pradeep Pawar sustained a bleeding injury to his right palm.
tier_1_determinative.actus_reus_description: The accused attempted to rob Vijay Sadavate and Pradeep Pawar by threatening them with a knife and causing injuries.

tier_2_material.number_of_perpetrators: Three accused persons were involved in the offense.
tier_2_material.victim_identity: Vijay Sadavate and Pradeep Pawar were the victims.
tier_2_material.previous_similar_incident: Yes, a similar attempt to rob Pradeep Pawar occurred shortly before the incident with Vijay Sadavate.
tier_2_material.medical_evidence: Medical evidence confirmed injuries to Vijay Sadavate's head and Pradeep Pawar's right palm.
tier_2_material.identification_parade: A Test Identification Parade was conducted where the accused were identified by the victims.

tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident occurred on 24th October 2009 at about 11.30 p.m.
tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident took place near Chembur Railway Station, Mumbai.
tier_3_contextual.victim_activity_before_incident: Vijay Sadavate was returning home from work and had alighted from a local train at Chembur Railway Station.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Aakash Ramchandra Chavan vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Section 394 read with Section 397 of the Indian Penal Code

residual_details.additional_facts: The accused Aakash Chavan was identified by the victims during the trial, and discrepancies in the victim's testimonies were deemed minor and not affecting the case outcome.

template_label: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt (IPC 397)
